name: Apricot Mustard-Glazed Salmon with Arugula
author: Happyschmoopies
summary: Grilled salmon with an apricot, mustard, and balsamic glaze served over a bed of baby arugula dressed with a simple vinaigrette made from the same ingredients as the glaze. This recipe was made in a Panasonic CIO.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Mix 1/4 cup apricot preserves, 1 1/2 tablespoon mustard, and 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar in a bowl to make glaze
Whisk 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 2 teaspoon apricot preserves, 1 teaspoon mustard, salt, and pepper together in a bowl
Drizzle in 1/4 cup olive oil, whisking constantly, until dressing is emulsified
Preheat Panasonic Countertop Induction Oven to Medium-High on the "Grill" setting
Brush 1 teaspoon of olive oil over both sides of each piece of salmon
Place salmon flesh-side down in the center of the grill pan
Set timer for 3 1/2 minutes and press "Start
" Flip salmon so skin side is down
Brush with glaze from one of the bowls
Set timer for 4 minutes and press "Start
" Remove salmon to a plate and spoon glaze from the second bowl on top
Place 1 1/2 cup arugula and 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes on each serving plate
